sen.j: 内海 忠勝（うつみ ただかつ、天保14年8月19日 (旧暦)（1843年9月12日） - 明治38年（1905年）1月20日）は、日本の武士、官僚、政治家。
sen.e: Tadakatsu UTSUMI (September 12, 1843 - January 20, 1905) was samurai as well as a government official and a statesman in Japan.
Tadakatsu UTSUMI (September 12, 1843 - January 20, 1905) was samurai as well as a government official and a statesman in Japan.
Tadakatsu UTSUMI (September 12, 1843 - January 20, 1905) was samurai as well as a government official and a statesman in Japan.

sen.j: 内務大臣（第20代）、長崎県令、三重県令、兵庫県知事、長野県知事（第2代）、神奈川県知事（第3代）、大阪府知事（第8代）、京都府知事（第8代）、会計検査院長、貴族院議員を務めた。
sen.e: He served as (the twentieth) Minister of Home Affairs, the prefectural governor of Nagasaki and Mie, the governor of Hyogo Prefecture, the (second) governor of Nagano Prefecture, the (third) governor of Kanagawa Prefecture, the (eighth) governor of Osaka Prefecture, the (the eight) governor of Kyoto Prefecture, the President of the Board of Audit, and a member of the House of Peers.

He served as (the twentieth) Minister of Home Affairs, the prefectural governor of Nagasaki and Mie, the governor of Hyogo Prefecture, the (second) governor of Nagano Prefecture, the (third) governor of Kanagawa Prefecture, the (eighth) governor of Osaka Prefecture, the (the eight) governor of Kyoto Prefecture, the President of the Board of Audit, and a member of the House of Peers.

He served as (the twentieth) Minister of Home Affairs, the prefectural governor of Nagasaki and Mie, the governor of Hyogo Prefecture, the (second) governor of Nagano Prefecture, the (third) governor of Kanagawa Prefecture, the (eighth) governor of Osaka Prefecture, the (the eight) governor of Kyoto Prefecture, the President of the Board of Audit, and a member of the House of Peers.
He was a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain.
He was a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain.
He was a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 従三位勲三等、死後に従二位勲一等大綬章。
sen.e: He received Jusanmi Kun Santo (Junior Third Rank, Third order of merit), and Jyunii-Kun Itto (Junior Second Rank, Grand Cordon of First order of merit) was conferred posthumously on him.
sen.cmt: 勲一等大綬章は直訳です
sen.e: He received Jusanmi Kun Santo (Junior Third Rank, Third order of merit), and Jyunii-Kun Itto (Junior Second Rank, Grand Cordon of First order of merit) was conferred posthumously on him.
He received Jusanmi Kun Santo (Junior Third Rank, Third order of merit), and Jyunii-Kun Itto (Junior Second Rank, Grand Cordon of First order of merit) was conferred posthumously on him.
He was a baron.
He was a baron.
He was a baron.

sen.j: 周防国吉敷郡吉敷村（現山口県山口市）出身。
sen.e: He was from Yoshiki Village, Yoshiki District, Suo Province (present Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).
He was from Yoshiki Village, Yoshiki District, Suo Province (present Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).
He was from Yoshiki Village, Yoshiki District, Suo Province (present Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: 長州藩士として蛤御門の変に参加。
sen.e: He joined the Hamaguri Gate Incident as a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain.
He joined the Hamaguri Gate Incident as a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain.
He joined the Hamaguri Gate Incident as a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 維新後新政府に登用され、岩倉使節団に大使随行員として参加。
sen.e: He was recruited by the new government after the Meiji Restoration and joined the Iwakura Mission as an attaché to the ambassador.
He was recruited by the new government after the Meiji Restoration and joined the Iwakura Mission as an attaché to the ambassador.
He was recruited by the new government after the Meiji Restoration and joined the Iwakura Mission as an attaché to the ambassador.

sen.j: 地方官として長崎、三重、兵庫、長野、神奈川、大阪、京都の各県令・知事を歴任。
sen.e: As a local official, he held various posts of the governor of prefectures such as Nagasaki, Mie, Hyogo, Nagano, Kanagawa, Osaka, Kyoto.
As a local official, he held various posts of the governor of prefectures such as Nagasaki, Mie, Hyogo, Nagano, Kanagawa, Osaka, and Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Kyoto の前に and を入れました。
sen.e: As a local official, he held various posts of the governor of prefectures such as Nagasaki, Mie, Hyogo, Nagano, Kanagawa, Osaka, and Kyoto.

sen.j: 1901年、第1次桂内閣で内務大臣に就任し初入閣を果たした。
sen.e: He got into the first Katsura cabinet as the Minister of Home Affairs in 1901.
He got into the first Katsura cabinet as the Minister of Home Affairs in 1901.
He got into the first Katsura cabinet as the Minister of Home Affairs in 1901.

sen.j: 山口県山口市に「内海忠勝顕彰碑」が建立されている。
sen.e: In Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, the "monument to honor Tadakatsu UTSUMI" was erected.
In Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, the "monument to honor Tadakatsu UTSUMI" was erected.
In Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, the "monument to honor Tadakatsu UTSUMI" was erected.
